blocks.text: Find the values of the following—

blocks.description: Differentiate the given functions with respect to x.

blocks.latex: \int \frac{\sin x}{\cos x} \: dx = \ln |\sec x + \tan x| + C.

blocks.text: We have previously seen that the derived curve of either the sine curve or the cosine curve is the primitive of itself, provided we consider the one-quarter of the period. Conversely, then, we may state that the sum of the area under the entire curve of a function defines the sum over all curves, when that sum or integral is taken. Thus, we find—

blocks.description: The derivatives of sine and cosine are repeated here.
